This card is highly valuable to me as well for two reasons: 1) It provides 2 Prestige Points, and 2) It grants a Black bonus. I currently possess 3 White and 3 Blue bonuses, meeting 2/3 of the requirements for Noble N6 (requires 3 White, 3 Blue, 3 Black). Securing Black bonuses is my top priority to unlock this Noble. By reserving L2_45, I prevent the opponent from getting easy points and secure a key component for my engine. Additionally, this action grants me a Gold token. I currently hold 1 Blue token and need 2 Blue tokens total to purchase L2_51 (2 Prestige Points, Blue bonus). The Gold token will serve as the second Blue token, allowing me to purchase L2_51 on the very next turn. This sequence effectively nets me a reservation of a key card and the resources to buy another high-value card immediately.

My primary objective is to purchase the reserved Level 2 card L2_45, which offers 2 Prestige Points and a Black bonuscritical for Noble N6. The card costs 5 White. With my 3 White bonuses, the remaining cost is 2 White. I currently hold 1 Gold token (wildcard) and 0 White tokens, meaning I need exactly 1 more White token to afford it. Since I cannot take 2 White tokens (only 3 available on board), I will take 3 different tokens: 1 White, 1 Green, and 1 Black. The White token secures the purchase of L2_45 for the next turn. The Green token is an investment towards L1_5 (requires Green/Red) to acquire another Black bonus later. The Black token contributes towards the cost of L1_26 (requires Black/White/Blue/Red), which offers a Green bonus. This move efficiently sets up a 2-point play while gathering resources for future engine development.

I will execute the plan formed in the previous turn: purchase the reserved Level 2 card L2_45. This card offers 2 Prestige Points and a Black bonus. The cost is 5 White. With my 3 White bonuses, the cost is reduced to 2 White. I currently hold 1 White token and 1 Gold token, which allows me to pay exactly the remaining cost. This move is optimal because it immediately increases my score to 6 and provides the first Black bonus required for Noble N6 (Needs 3 White, 3 Blue, 3 Black), bringing me closer to the 15-point goal. I have 2 Black tokens remaining which can be used in subsequent turns to acquire green or black bonus cards.

I will purchase the Level 1 card L1_26. This is an extremely efficient move for my engine. The card costs 1 White, 1 Blue, 1 Red, and 2 Black. My bonuses (3 White, 3 Blue, 1 Red, 1 Black) cover all costs except for 1 Black token, which I can afford with my stockpile of 2 Black tokens. Acquiring this Green bonus is strategic for two reasons: 1) It immediately reduces the cost of my next target, the Black-bonus card L1_5 (requires 2 Green), allowing me to purchase it with my single existing Green token on the next turn. Without this bonus, I would need to waste a turn gathering more tokens to afford L1_5. 2) It opens a path towards Noble N8 (requiring 3 Green bonuses) while I continue pursuing Noble N6 (requiring 3 Black bonuses). This move accelerates my card acquisition rate, effectively turning 1 token into 1 permanent bonus and enabling a combo for the next turn.

I will execute the planned purchase of Level 1 card L1_5. This card requires 2 Green and 1 Red. My bonuses (1 Green, 1 Red) reduce the cost to exactly 1 Green token, which I currently possess. This purchase is highly strategic as it provides my 2nd Black bonus. I am aiming for Noble N6 (requires 3 White, 3 Blue, 3 Black), and I already possess the required 3 White and 3 Blue bonuses. After this move, I will need only one more Black bonus to automatically trigger the Noble and gain 3 Prestige Points. This move keeps my momentum efficient, adhering to the plan established in the previous turn.
